summary: In this project, the use of PLMs as extractors and the end-to-end fine-tuning approach (prompt tuning, etc.) are compared to validate the comprehension capabilities of PLMs at different scales in understanding human values.
title: Fine-tuning vs Prompting, Can Language Models Understand Human Values?

summary: This is my graduation thesis, using the NECore to build up a SoC with a CNN accelerator.
title: High-performance CPU Design and AI Application Based on MIPS ISA

summary: Based on the BERT model, this project enhances the performance of the model on extremely unbalanced data sets through a variety of finetuning methods and a contrastive learning task.
title: BERT Based Sentiment Analysis

summary: This project uses deep learning methods to solve the problems of DR diagnosis from fundus photos, the tissue segmentation of cardiac MRI, and the super-resolution of lung CT images.
title: Medical Image Processing

summary: Here is a project for NSCSCC2022 group competition. A CPU called "NECore" is built in Verilog and can be run both on Vivado & FPGA board.
title: NECore:A 6-stage Piepline CPU Based on MIPS32

summary: This project includes several submodules of the diabetic retinopathy diagnosis system, including macular positioning, vascular segmentation, and grading. Models like YOLO, UNet, and Efficientnet are applied to analyze fundus images and assist in the diagnosis of DR.
title: Fundus Image Analysis with Deep Learning Methods
